title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 September 2015 - XWiki

10:08 <AE\_Bertrand> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <AE\_Bertrand> Hi, I'm using Xwiki7.0, I've attached html5 pages to my document and created a link to the attachment  
10:10 <vmassol> Hi AE\_Bertrand First, you should consider upgrading to 7.1.2 :)  
10:10 <AE\_Bertrand> I now have a revision for the attachment and have uploaded it  
10:11 <AE\_Bertrand> and the the link on my document still refers to revision 1.1 instead of pointing to the newest version  
10:11 <AE\_Bertrand> it defeats the purpose a bit I think  
10:12 <vmassol> hmm doesn't ring a bell  
10:12 <vmassol> what's your link like?  
10:12 <vmassol> I mean the wiki syntax and the generated HTML <A>  
10:13 <AE\_Bertrand> the syntax is xwiki2.1 and the html is html5 with svg inside  
10:13 <AE\_Bertrand> when I open the link to the attachment it open the html page  
10:14 <vmassol> can you show us the wiki syntax you've used?  
10:14 <AE\_Bertrand> sure  
10:15 <AE\_Bertrand> ==== The meerkat schema ====  [[meerkat generated 2015-09-09>>attach:Meerkat (partial).html]]   ==== The ETL2 schema ====   [[ETL2 generated 2015-09-09>>attach:ETL2 tables.html]]  the images are clickable to go to more details.  
10:16 <vmassol> ok sounds good and what URL do you get when you view the page and hover over "meerkat generated 2015-09-09"?  
10:18 <AE\_Bertrand> the revised do is ETL actually, it looks like : https://wiki.<AE>.com/xwiki/bin/download/Main/The+Schema/ETL2%20tables.html  
10:18 <AE\_Bertrand> incidently I get the same link when refering to the attachment tab  
10:18 <vmassol> ok sounds good, there's no revision in the URL  
10:19 <vmassol> when you open a new browser tab with this url do you see the latest version?  
10:19 <AE\_Bertrand> the only way to access the newest version is explicitly refering to the revision : https://wiki.<AE>.com/xwiki/bin/downloadrev/Main/The+Schema/ETL2%20tables.html?rev=1.2  
10:20 <vmassol> maybe there's some browser cahing  
10:20 <vmassol> have you tried rereshing your browser cache?  
10:22 <AE\_Bertrand> you are correct opening in Edge it opened the right document  
10:22 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:23 <AE\_Bertrand> ok closed ticket! thank you vincent  
10:23 <vmassol> cool  
10:24 <AE\_Bertrand> by the way great job and great software  
10:24 <vmassol> thanks Bertrand!  
10:24 <vmassol> just starting using it?  
10:25 <AE\_Bertrand> we have been fiddling with it for a year, with set up issues and no sysadmin on the job. now we are making fast progress  
10:25 <vmassol> ok cool  
10:25 <vmassol> we love testimonials so if you like xwiki (or when you like it enough! :)), maybe you could write a few words about xwiki online and we can then include it in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Feedback#HTestimonials :)  
10:26 <AE\_Bertrand> ça marche  
10:26 <AE\_Bertrand> by  
10:26 <AE\_Bertrand> has quit  
10:26 <vmassol> merci!  
10:26 <vmassol> bye

11:27 <vmassol> checking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-annotation-test-tests/1823/testReport/org.xwiki.annotation.test.ui/AnnotationsTest/annotationsShouldNotBeShownInXWiki10Syntax/

11:35 <gdelhumeau> it's still in place  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> even if we no longer support IE8  
11:36 <vmassol> ok I'll add a note

13:30 <vmassol> guys what about we mute the test wiki in notifications? :)  
13:31 <vmassol> or should we just start a new IRC channels for notifications?  
13:33 <vmassol> #xwiki + #xwikinotifications and have the bot on #xwikinotifications FTM?  
13:33 <vmassol> anyone who woulld be interested in that? If so I can send a proposal on the list  
13:34 <vmassol> hmm I wonder if there's a way in my IRC client to mute some messages  
13:34 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <vmassol> evalica: ok found the pb with the anno test… (took me too long to figure out!). Was the "document"->"page" change again )  
13:43 <vmassol> :)  
13:45 <vmassol> checking org.xwiki.messagestream.test.ui.AdministrationTest. now  
13:49 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
13:50 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <evalica> vmassol: … sorry :)  
13:51 <Enygma`> I`m starting to look into the build health since I`ll be handling the 7.2RC release on Monday (swapped with gdelhumeau)  
13:51 <vmassol> ok Enygma` I'm also doing that ATM to help out  
13:51 <vmassol> I'm on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-messagestream-test-tests/1825/testReport/org.xwiki.messagestream.test.ui/AdministrationTest/verifyGlobalAndSpaceSections/ right now  
13:51 <Enygma`> ok  
13:51 <vmassol> FTM I don't see how it can happen :)  
13:52 <vmassol> (since toggleDrawer() does a proper wait)  
13:56 <vrachieru> has quit  
13:59 <Enygma`> vmassol: This could be a good time to test the jenkins claim plugin that we more or less agreed to try out. I`m going to try to install it and configure it.  
14:01 <vmassol> ok  
14:26 <vmassol> Enygma`: I think I should close this issue as won't fix now right: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9763 ?  
14:26 <vmassol> (and fix all tests accordingly)  
14:27 <vmassol> (I think you forgot to fix this when you refactored the tests)  
14:31 <Enygma`> vmassol: looks like we can close it.  
14:31 <vmassol> ok doing it  
14:32 <Enygma`> re tests, see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9d2425fa99523218fa9bd43eb86ce92bf3db79c2  
14:32 <vmassol> yes that's what I said  
14:32 <vmassol> you forgot to remofe some parts :)  
14:32 <Enygma`> which?  
14:33 <Enygma`> selectSpaceToAdminister now wraps gotoSpaceAdministrationPage  
14:33 <Enygma`> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9d2425fa99523218fa9bd43eb86ce92bf3db79c2#diff-6f0dc8b57754f2ab98f473af68607fc5R234  
14:33 <vmassol> for example: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/xwiki-platform-administration-test/xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/src/test/it/org/xwiki/administration/test/ui/AdministrationTest.java#L52  
14:34 <vmassol> the only reason there was the create page was to crate a page in the xwiki sace  
14:34 <vmassol> \*space  
14:34 <vmassol> so that the XWiki space appeared in the selector  
14:34 <Enygma`> oh, I see what you mean  
14:34 <vmassol> so that the test could navigate to its admin  
14:34 <Enygma`> yes, that slipped  
14:34 <vmassol> I'm fixing messagestream ATM  
14:35 <Enygma`> I see it in mail, administration and messagestream  
14:35 <Enygma`> I`ll take administration  
14:35 <vmassol> in admin it should be different than the rest I think  
14:36 <vmassol> in the other places we should go diretly to the admin pages  
14:36 <vmassol> while for administration we should navigate  
14:36 <vmassol> (ie to validate that that Drawer link works fine)  
14:36 <vmassol> \*that the  
14:37 <vmassol> I'll take mail  
14:38 <Enygma`> yes, that`s how it`s done right now with AdministrationPage.clickAdministerWiki()  
14:38 <vmassol> yes for administration it's ok, less so for the mail and messagestream tests  
14:38 <vmassol> I'm fixing them anyway  
14:39 <Enygma`> yes  
14:39 <vmassol> now I'm still not 100% convinced that we don't need a way to move from the admin of a space to another...  
14:39 <vmassol> but we'll see  
14:40 <vmassol> (I think we're going a bit backward on this)  
14:46 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <vmassol> 16 test failures in escaping tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
14:58 <vmassol> I tihnk they're all the same  
14:59 <vmassol> they seem related to your changes gdelhumeau  
14:59 <gdelhumeau> let me see  
14:59 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
14:59 <gdelhumeau> fixing  
15:19 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:34 <tmortagne> most of the xwiki-enterprise-test-extension failing test are failing because it's finding in REST thing it deleted  
15:34 <tmortagne> s/REST/SOLR/  
15:35 <tmortagne> so either SOLR does not properly react to delete anymore or getRepositoryTestUtils().waitUntilReady(); has been broken (probably this one)  
15:35 <tmortagne> so this.solrUtils.waitEmpyQueue() actually  
15:36 <tmortagne> SolrTestUtils#waitEmpyQueue()  
15:41 <mflorea> has quit  
15:48 <MasterPiece> has quit  
15:49 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
15:55 <tmortagne> all pass locally so the issue is most probably with SolrTestUtils#waitEmpyQueue()  
16:03 <[d\_\_d]> has quit  
16:05 <[d\_\_d]> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <OSIMasson> has quit  
16:22 <tmortagne> SolrTestUtils#waitEmpyQueue() seems to work well, no idea what is the issue...  
16:38 <tmortagne> ok found a trick to reproduce it actually, Solr module is actually not that accurate when indicating the queue size  
17:17 <tmortagne> I think I fixed the Solr related failing extension tests, lets see (I cannot reproduce in a real test locally, only by cheating so hard to be sure)  
17:18 <vmassol> 6 failing wysiwyg tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
17:19 <vmassol> fixing  
17:19 <vmassol> I know why they're failing  
17:19 <vmassol> (I caused the failure I think :))  
17:20 <vmassol> hmm another example of an image not showing up: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/RegularUserTest/testImageSelectorHidesTechnicalSpaces/  
17:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: I guess you worked on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest/testCreateGroupWhenGroupAlreadyExists/ already ? ("page" vs "document" issue)  
17:22 <vmassol> I don't think so  
17:22 <vmassol> go ahead  
17:22 <vmassol> (if you want)  
17:23 <tmortagne> ok  
17:24 <Enygma`> vmassol: that test failed with "Timed out after 10 seconds waiting for org.xwiki.test.ui.XWikiWebDriver$1@1ab71c17"  
17:24 <Enygma`> so I guess no screenshot could have been taken  
17:24 <tmortagne> hmm actually it is the opposite, the test expect "page" and gets "document"  
17:25 <vmassol> ah :) maybe I was overzealous somewhere  
17:25 <Enygma`> actually, forget what I said :)  
17:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: yep that's it  
17:25 <vmassol> we should change the translation instead probably  
17:25 <tmortagne> but it probably actually mean that some message were not modified as it should  
17:25 <tmortagne> yes  
17:26 <vmassol> yes  
17:26 <Enygma`> still, it was in the AbstractWysiwygTestCase.setUp phase, so it was a low lever failure still  
17:26 <tmortagne> checking  
17:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: the message is ok AFAICS, just XE not up to date probably  
17:27 <vmassol> ok  
17:32 <tmortagne> does anyone has any idea if we removed "data-xwiki-gwt:property" from <html> element ?  
17:32 <tmortagne> that's what makes http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/LanguageTest/testHeaderCorrectLanguage/ fail  
17:32 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau ?  
17:32 <gdelhumeau> I don't know  
17:32 <vmassol> I remember checking this failure several days ago and asking here  
17:33 <vmassol> it wasn't the problem though I think  
17:33 <vmassol> but I don't recall  
17:34 <tmortagne> it's 40 builds old so hard to say exactly when it started  
17:35 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <tmortagne> Enygma`: actually what broke this test is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/224249f543a6a39eed9464d4fe20f2f2f37e8bde  
17:38 <tmortagne> some tests still expect getMetaDataValue to look at <meta> and not <html>  
17:41 <tmortagne> (and yes as far as I can see gwt:property is still a <meta> property)  
17:44 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/DeletePageTest/testDeletePageIsImpossibleWhenNoDeleteRights/ seems a real debug. Trying to reproduce locally  
17:47 <vmassol> actually it seems to be the logout which didn't work for some reason  
17:48 <vmassol> hmm seems toggleDrawer() doesn't always work  
17:49 <vmassol> I have seen another tests where it didn't click after toggleDrawer() was called  
17:49 <vmassol> and now logout() seems to not have worked either after toggleDraer()  
17:50 <Enygma`> tmortagne: I guess I need to add something like BasePage.getDocumentProperty(String propertyName)  
17:51 <tmortagne> or getHTMLProperty not sure which one is best  
17:51 <Enygma`> and replace the usage of getMetaDataValue as much as possible  
17:51 <tmortagne> I guess yours is more semantic  
17:51 <vmassol> yes HTMLProperty is better I think  
17:51 <vmassol> since a document's property has other meanings for us  
17:51 <Enygma`> but that`s what is stored in those data-xwiki properties  
17:51 <Enygma`> there are properties/values about the document  
17:51 <vmassol> this is not an xproperty for sure  
17:52 <Enygma`> xproperties are usually about classes or objects  
17:52 <Enygma`> getDocumentValue()?  
17:52 <vmassol> same  
17:53 <Enygma`> then getDocumentMetaData :)  
17:53 <Enygma`> to distinguish it from the HTML generic MetaData  
17:53 <vmassol> yes ok  
17:54 <tmortagne> looks like Blog.WebHome titles changed from "The Wiki Blog" to "Blog", is this expected ?  
17:55 <vmassol> yes  
17:55 <tmortagne> ok updating the test then  
17:55 <vmassol> I fixed 2 like these already  
17:55 <vmassol> let me give your jira id  
17:55 <vmassol> there are 2  
17:55 <vmassol> XWIKI-12459  
17:55 <vmassol> XWIKI-12516  
17:55 <vmassol> 3 actually  
17:55 <vmassol> Wiki Home —> Home  
17:55 <tmortagne> thanks  
17:55 <vmassol> XWiki Space -> XWiki  
17:56 <vmassol> The Wiki Blog -> Blog  
17:58 <vmassol> hmm re http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/DeletePageTest/testDeletePageIsImpossibleWhenNoDeleteRights/ the logout should have been clicked as otherwise we would have gotten a timeout  
17:59 <vmassol> I need some help on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/DeletePageTest/testDeletePageIsImpossibleWhenNoDeleteRights/ , I can't figure out the problem  
17:59 <vmassol> it's a very simple test though  
18:00 <vmassol> 2 lines:  
18:00 <vmassol> this.viewPage.logout();  
18:00 <vmassol> canDelete is true when the test fails because logout has not worked and user is still logged in  
18:01 <vmassol> but the code for logout() is:  
18:01 <vmassol> toggleDrawer();  
18:01 <vmassol> getDriver().findElement(By.id("tmLogout")).click();  
18:01 <vmassol> so if the findElement could not have been found we would have had a timeout  
18:01 <vmassol> so it was there and click() has been called  
18:02 <vmassol> I doubt that logging out is async  
18:02 <vmassol> hmm there's a redirect though probably  
18:03 <vmassol> so maybe we need to wait for the second page load to be finished or something like this  
18:03 <vmassol> checking  
18:04 <Enygma`> wdyt if instead of adding a new getDocumentMetaDataValue method, I add a new getHTMLMetaDataValue and only fix the tests that were using getMetaDataValue to get actual HTML meta fields?  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I don't reprodce the fail localy  
18:05 <vmassol> yes I'm sure it's flickering  
18:07 <vmassol> in any case the first HTTP call is for http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/logout/XWiki/XWikiLogout?xredirect=%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FMain%2FTest%2F%3Fviewer%3Dcontent and that will log the user out  
18:07 <vmassol> then second call is the redirect  
18:07 <vmassol> so I don't see why the user icon would still be displayed  
18:07 <Enygma`> vmassol, tmortagne: anything against that?  
18:07 <vmassol> Enygma`: ok for me  
18:08 <Enygma`> k  
18:08 <vmassol> since we're not supposed to use the old fields right?  
18:08 <vmassol> only one issue is that we'll be missing a test for them if I understand correctly  
18:09 <vmassol> aren't they only avail when the skin is colibri?  
18:09 <vmassol> (that's what I don't understand)  
18:09 <vmassol> except for the gwt: stuff  
18:09 <vmassol> which is still valid  
18:09 <vmassol> and has not alternative  
18:09 <vmassol> so not sure what you mean Enygma` :)  
18:10 <Enygma`> not sure I follow vmassol  
18:11 <Enygma`> the meta fields are used in colibri  
18:11 <vmassol> we have colibri tests?  
18:11 <vmassol> thought we had only flamingo ones  
18:11 <Enygma`> AFAIK we only have flamingo tests  
18:12 <Enygma`> but even in flamingo, those meta fields are still there  
18:12 <Enygma`> but deprecated  
18:12 <Enygma`> and the tests were still using the old way  
18:12 <vmassol> ??  
18:12 <vmassol> where?  
18:12 <Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/224249f543a6a39eed9464d4fe20f2f2f37e8bde  
18:13 <Enygma`> this is what I mean  
18:13 <vmassol> chcecking something I may be confusing something  
18:13 <vmassol> Enygma`: do you know where the <meta> are added in flamingo?  
18:14 <Enygma`> htmlheader.vm  
18:14 <vmassol> which line?  
18:14 <vmassol> I'm looking at it  
18:14 <Enygma`> ah, wait  
18:14 <vmassol> but can't see  
18:14 <Enygma`> you asked the meta  
18:14 <vmassol> AFAIR they're not  
18:14 <vmassol> yes  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> no  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> it's a javascript that put them  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> for retro-compatibility  
18:19 <vmassol> ah.....  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> but they are not in the templates anymore  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> if not, the HTML5 is angry  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> because these tags are not valid anymore  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> (html5 validator)  
18:19 <Enygma`> yes, I can`t remember how that js is called  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> compatibility.js  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> at the end of the file  
18:20 <Enygma`> right  
18:20 <Enygma`> I know I`ve seen it before  
18:26 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:26 <Enygma`> tmortagne, vmassol: you can now use the BasePage.getHTMLMetaDataValue(metaName) method to fix the tests that are failing because they were using BasePage.getMetaDataValue instead  
18:26 <Enygma`> or tell me the list and I can fix them myself  
18:26 <vmassol> no idea :)  
18:29 <vmassol> so we have still 3 open issues for RC1  
18:29 <vmassol> all on marius!  
18:29 <vmassol> maybe we can help him somewhere...  
18:29 <vmassol> we'll see tomorrow  
18:29 <vmassol> Denis: for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12165 what's your plan?  
18:31 <Denis> no short term plan, I am more worry by the issue in the AuthorizationManager found by Marius earlier, was that one reported somewhere ?
